page.title: 04Farming Around Maltby
page.content: The area comprises Grades 2 and 3 agricultural land. As a lowland area,with fertile calcareous brown earth soils, and a rainfall of about 675mm per annum the physical factors are highly favourable to arable farming. The leading crops are peas, barley,wheat,potatoes and oilseed rape. The rapid expansion of rape has been a feature of the last decade. Another change hs been the increase in the winter sowing of barley. The area has Â£een spared the worst effects of "prairie" farming,though some hedges have been removed. Hedgerows and woods are retained by shooting interests. Grassland tends to occupy steeper slopes and less well drained meadows. Though most farms are arable, mixed farms have sheep or dairy and beef cattle utilising both grass and fodder.
